answers.answer: A retinal detachment would have been very obvious and almost impossible to miss if you saw an ophthalmologist and had a dilated exam.  If you haven't seen an ophthalmologist you need to right away.  The black dot in the good eye could be a floater but I would still call your ophthalmologist tommorow and you should probably be seen in the office to see exactly what is going in the good eye.  I'm sorry about  your problem with presumed optic neuritis - that must really have you very concerned - I hope you have a major recovery and no future problems.MJK MD
